title: Senior Embeddedutvecklare
description:
Vi söker nu en skicklig embeddedutvecklare med gedigen erfarenhet av att ta produkter från idéstadiet ända fram till färdig lösning. I denna roll kommer du att arbeta med utveckling av inbyggda system där Yocto/Linux utgör teknologins ryggrad. Utöver detta ingår arbete med produktionstest, CI/CD-processer samt systemoptimering för att säkerställa att våra lösningar håller högsta kvalitet och prestanda.
  
Som senior utvecklare blir du en central del av teamet och förväntas med din tekniska expertis inom C/C++ – samt eventuellt Rust – vara med och driva utvecklingen av våra produkter. Rollen är placerad i Göteborg, där din erfarenhet och ditt ledarskap spelar en avgörande roll för att förverkliga innovativa idéer och stärka våra tekniska processer.
  
Dina Arbetsuppgifter
  
  

**Utveckling av Inbyggda System:**  

Arbeta med att designa och implementera robusta lösningar med Yocto/Linux som bas, där du säkerställer att systemen är både skalbara och optimerade för produktion.
  
  

**Projektledning från Koncept till Lansering:**  

Ansvara för hela utvecklingsprocessen – från tidig konceptualisering och kravanalys till färdig produkt – med fokus på kvalitet och innovation.
  
  

**Programmering:**  

Utveckla och underhålla mjukvara med hjälp av C/C++ och, där det är relevant, Rust för att möta specifika tekniska krav.
  
  

**CI/CD och Produktionsmiljö:**  

Implementera, utveckla och förbättra CI/CD-processer för att effektivisera utvecklingscykeln samt säkerställa att produkterna genomgår noggranna produktionstester.
  
  

**Systemoptimering:**  

Analysera och förbättra systemens prestanda och stabilitet, med kontinuerlig optimering av arbetsflöden och testprocesser.
  
Kravprofil
  
  

**Erfarenhet:**  

Flera års praktisk erfarenhet av produktutveckling inom inbyggda system, med ett dokumenterat resultat av att driva projekt från idé till färdig produkt.
  
  

**Teknisk Kompetens:**  

Djupgående kunskap om Yocto/Linux och stark programmeringserfarenhet i C/C++; erfarenhet av Rust är meriterande.
  
  

**Process- och Testkompetens:**  

Erfarenhet av att arbeta med produktionstest och att implementera CI/CD-miljöer för att säkerställa smidiga och effektiva utvecklingsprocesser.
  
  

**Språkkunskaper:**  

Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska, såväl i tal som skrift.
  
Övrig Information
  
**– Plats:** Göteborg (arbete sker på plats)
  
**– Uppdragslängd:** Minst 6 månader, med möjlighet till förlängning
  
Är du redo att använda din tekniska expertis för att leda och utveckla banbrytande inbyggda system? Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en nyckelspelare i vårt team.
  
Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Senior Embeddedutvecklare Yocto/Linux, C/C++
description:
Om företaget
  
Avaron AB är ett konsultbolag som brinner för tekniska innovationer och kvalitativa lösningar. Vi är stolta över att kunna erbjuda spännande konsultuppdrag hos våra kunder, där du som utvecklare får möjlighet att växa professionellt och bidra med din expertis i engagerande projekt.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
I detta uppdrag kommer du att arbeta som konsult hos en av våra kunder i Göteborg. Fokus ligger på inbyggda system med Yocto/Linux som grund. Du förväntas:
  
Utveckla och förbättra mjukvarulösningar för inbyggda system
  
Vara delaktig i produktutveckling, från idéstadiet till färdig lösning
  
Använda främst C/C++ och eventuellt Rust i utvecklingsarbetet
  
Arbeta med CI/CD-processer för att säkerställa kvalitet och effektivitet
  
Optimera och genomföra tester för produktion
  
  

Som senior utvecklare blir du en nyckelspelare i teamet. Din erfarenhet och ditt tekniska kunnande kommer att driva projektet framåt och bidra till att skapa högkvalitativa produkter.
  
Kvalifikationer (Ska-krav)
  
Flerårig erfarenhet av att utveckla inbyggda system
  
Goda kunskaper i Yocto/Linux för embedded-lösningar
  
Gedigen kompetens i C/C++
  
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med produktionstest och CI/CD
  
Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
  
  

Meriterande (Bra att ha)
  
Erfarenhet av Rust
  
Vana av att leda produktutvecklingsprojekt från början till slut
  
Tidigare arbete med optimering av systemprestanda
  
  

Ansökan
  
Skicka ditt personliga brev och CV till jobb@avaron.se. Ange "Senior Embeddedutvecklare – Yocto/Linux, C/C++ (ID 12558)" i ämnesraden för att underlätta vår hantering. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och möjligheten att välkomna dig till vårt team på Avaron AB!

title: Test Developer
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **3+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

 **Rollbeskrivning:**


As a developer with analysis and verification focus, you work in an agile cross-functional team. You use your test expertise to take an active role in coaching your team members in all matters relating to quality from a test perspective. This includes, but is not limited to, ensuring testability while designing an architecture or developing a function, writing and sometimes guiding the team to write test cases and automating tests for regression testing. As a team player in an agile cross-functional team, you do what is necessary to achieve the team goals. Therefore, you will also learn and gain insights from other disciplines in the team.  

  

**Main responsibilities**  

* Support the team in test related activities during design and development
* Design, implement and run test methods in an automated test environment and perform system- and function testing
* Develop features in the test automation framework to enable more automated testing
* Report test results and appropriate recommendations to stakeholders
* Analyze defects and issues

  

**Required qualifications**  

* Minimum a B.Sc. in Physics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent
* Former experience from working with quality assurance of complex embedded systems
* Fluent in English (written and spoken)
* Valid driver’s license B
* Experience working with Simulink development and C++

  

**Meritorious qualifications**  

* Experience from automotive and Body / Comfort systems development
* Experience of working with CANoe, Jenkins and other test framework
* Experience from working with Volvo systems such as Elektra, CarCom or System/Car Weaver.
* Experience of test automation, programming or model-based development / testing

  

**Personal qualities**  

* Analytical
* Cooperative
* Creative
* Innovative
**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**About Kivra**


We ask ourselves every day if there is a better way to manage your important documents. Why do we cut down trees, process them in factories to make paper and then transport that paper to mailboxes all over the country - when we can send letters, invoices and receipts digitally?


Why should you run up to the attic to dig out your high school transcript or search through files in vain, looking for old service contracts? With our upload service, you can store everything that is important to you in one place. A place that is safe, environmentally friendly and that you can access whenever you want.


More than six million people in Sweden have already discovered Kivra. And more than fifty-five thousand companies and authorities are connected to our network. But our journey has only just begun and we are going to continue to push ourselves to become an even better place for your most important things.

**Are you our next Frontend Developer?**


Our services are growing more popular by the day, and we’re growing with them. So now we’re looking for someone with talent and passion for frontend development. As a frontend developer at Kivra you’ll be part of building a massive scalable platform. Our services deal with large amounts of users, data and transactions on a daily basis. As a frontend developer at Kivra, you’ll be part of developing services used by millions of Swedes.


Together with the team on both mobile and web applications, you will be focusing on improving existing services and features, as well as creating new ones. Our architecture is built from interconnected microservices with Erlang and Go backend in a Kubernetes cluster, powered by Docker containers.

**The position will include tasks such as:**

* Maintain and develop new functionalities in our BFF (Backend for Frontend) service.
* Assist iOS and Android developers in enabling new features for our clients.
* Developing Kivra's web services in Typescript, React and GraphQL.
* Improve our services, both for the end-users as well as our developers.
* Learn and teach new solutions for the rest of the team.
* Advocate for best practices and newer technologies. You need to be able to distill hype from practical applications.
* Breaking down abstract problems into concrete solutions.


We are looking for:


You have +5 years of experience as a Frontend developer- more specifically in software development, agile methodology as well as TypeScript, React, and the web platform in general. You love to work with all aspects of agile development focusing on writing, reading, and talking about the code. Equally, you also hold a degree in a relevant field. Knowledge is important but so is attitude! Kivra’s culture is strongly influenced by kindness, drive and the desire to produce high-quality work. How you fit in with your team is super important, and just like us, we believe that you thrive on being nice, helpful and always encouraging growth.


Moreover, we are looking for people who:

* Have solid experience in Typescript.
* Have a keen eye for API design and best practices.
* Care about performance and know how to develop features that scale efficiently.
* Have experience in React, Angular, Vue or any other frontend framework.
* Have experience in testing on different levels.


There is a plus if you also have experience with the following, or want to learn:

* Web accessibility.
* Web performance.
* GraphQL for client-side and/or server-side
* NodeJS and/or Deno.
* Golang.
* Elixir
* Erlang

  

You will be part of the Frontend Team and report to the Engineering Manager for the Frontend team. Fluency in English is required and fluency in Swedish is a plus but not required. We are unfortunately not able to sponsor new work permits, but are able to sponsor/renew existing work permits.  

  

Just like us, you are passionate about your craft and take ownership of your own development.


**We offer**


Kivra offers a place in a committed team with the opportunity for a high degree of innovation. You will be involved in influencing Kivra's exciting business and product development of a service that is currently used by more than half of Sweden's population. One of Kivra's values is happy-happy, which is also reflected in the concern for Kivra's staff. In addition to collective agreements and wellness, we offer a number of other great benefits.

**How to apply**


Easy peasy, just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact Andreas Nilsson, Talent Acquisition Partner, at Andreas.Nilsson@kivra.com


  
Teams
Tech
Role
Frontend developer
Locations
Stockholm

title: Online Portfolio Developer
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Join us at BNEW EUHW ST CHR, where we act as the glue between organizations, enabling efficient commercial handling and release of Ericsson products. Our mission is to investigate and orchestrate optimal ways of working from both the customer and Ericsson's perspectives, leveraging opportunities, and driving necessary changes. Our vision is to provide an excellent customer experience by making customized commercial capabilities available and useful throughout the end-to-end process.


We are seeking an energetic and positive next generation talent to join our dynamic and diverse team in the Portfolio and Commerce department. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of improving Ericsson product information quality and as well contribute to our digital transformation journey.


The objective of this role is to oversee enhancements to product information within Ericsson's product catalog featured in Portfolio and Commerce (SAP Commerce). This responsibility also encompasses data analytics and tools development for operations efficiency.

 **What you will do:**

 **Portfolio and Commerce**

  

* Provide ticket support to internal and external using back-office applications.
* Suggest and support domain and cross-functional improvements.
* Contribute to the development of internal tools, WoW and processes.
* Improve documentation.
* Participate in user acceptance testing and document functionalities.
* Implement back-office improvements activities.
* Onboard new products into Portfolio and Commerce.
* Be a change advocate.

* **Data analytics and Tool development**
  

* Support the development and maintenance of CHR analytics dashboard.
* Support the development and maintenance of internal tools for operations efficiency.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* Education: Master in of science in engineering - IT
* Programing in different languages – phyton, C, SQL, etc.
* Technical curiosity for troubleshooting and testing.
* Good communication and presentation skills.
* Structured and organized.
* Understanding the need for changes and the ability to drive them.

 **Soft skills**

* Curious.
* Fast learner.
* Team player.
* Resilient
* Positive attitude and energy
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Software Developer Mobile Networks
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

We are looking for curious and creative software developers to join our team and help build a product that millions of people use every day for one of our most profound needs as human beings – communication.


You will play an important part in our team of brilliant software developers, implementing new features, improving performance, and building elegant solutions for our customers.


We work with radio base stations, at the core of mobile communication, enablers of emerging technologies, such as 5G and IoT. Our products are involved in anything from streaming video, listening to music while on the move, to old-school voice communication like calling grandma.

 **What you will do:**

  

Develop functionality in a complex system, enabling everyday communication for millions of people around the globe.


You will work in an agile scrum team and collaborate closely with other developers in the team.


The team develop new functionality in a large software system from early requirement phases to customer deliveries.


You will work according to scrum methodology within your team and work with tasks prioritized in team’s backlog.


Work from our awesome office in Gothenburg at the river waterfront.

 **Who you are:**

  

You are a skilled developer with a passion for technology and software development.


You are curious about new technologies and you like working in a fast-paced and agile environment.


You know how to write readable and maintainable C++ and Java supported by well-defined processes and guidelines.


You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high quality code.


You value team success over personal success.

 **What we offer:**

  

We offer an open atmosphere with plenty of opportunities for personal development. A culture where sharing knowledge and helping each other comes as natural as challenging existing ways of working and continuously striving to improve.


Apart from offering a unique environment working with great developers, we offer a modern work environment. When taking a break, there is free freshly brewed coffee in our in-house café and a large recreational area with a shuffleboard and a well-equipped gym. In addition, we also provide compensation for medical costs, monthly lunch benefits and plenty of money for physical activities.


We also offer a diverse multi-cultural community, where everyone is given equal opportunities to succeed.

  

Do you want to join a great team? Please send us your application already today!

 **Qualifications:**

  

You have a Bachelor or Master of Science (e.g Science within Electrical Engineering, Data Communication, Computer Science and Engineering, Software Engineering of Distributed Systems, Engineering Physics) or equivalent formal education.

 **Work Location:**

  

These positions are based in Göteborg

title: Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 As a Backend Software Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing backend systems while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop scalable and resilient distributed systems using C# and .NET Core.
* Work closely with engineers, DevOps specialists, and product managers in an agile, cross-functional team.
* Build and maintain applications running on Kubernetes, actively monitor production systems, and ensure reliability.
* Leverage AWS tools and services to deploy, optimize, and scale cloud-based systems.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Strong professional experience building and maintaining backend systems in production.
* Expertise in C#, .NET Core, and developing distributed systems.
* Solid understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Service-oriented architecture and microservices.
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and AWS.
* Relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, MSSQL, Redis).
* Incident response and on-call rotations.
* Mobile SDK development experience


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with remote work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
**Code. Build. Impact.** 

 If you thrive on ownership, cutting-edge tech, and solving real problems, this is the role you’ve been looking for. At Banky, we’re rewriting the rules of consumer credit with smarter technology to improve the financial future of thousands of customers.
 





 Join our innovative fintech startup, based in Stockholm at Eriksbergsgatan, and make a lasting impact.
 




  





**Why Join Banky?** 




  




* **Tech Stack You’ll Enjoy:**
* **Backend:** 

 Java 21+, Spring Boot 3.4+, JUnit 5, PostgreSQL
* **Frontend:** 

 HTML, CSS, JavaScript, HTMX, React
* **Infrastructure:** 

 AWS (Fargate, RDS, Amazon MQ)
* **CI/CD:** 

 GitHub Actions
* **Ship Fast, No Bureaucracy:** 

 Your code hits production quickly and directly impacts customers.
* **Own What You Build:** 

 Drive features, architecture, and improvements.
* **Tackle Real Problems:** 

 Work on complex challenges, from optimizing credit decision algorithms to designing scalable, high-performance backend services.
* **Refine Processes:** 

 Continuously improve development workflows, including code reviews, design decisions, and scalability strategies.
* **Contribute to Culture:** 

 Help shape technical discussions, team dynamics, and growth as a key member of the development team.



  





**Who You Are** 





 We value problem solvers who take ownership, adapt quickly, and focus on practical, high-impact solutions.
 




  





**Your Skills:** 




  




* **3+ years** 

 of experience as a full-stack developer with strong backend knowledge.
* **Proficiency in Java** 

 (especially Spring Boot)
* **Self-sufficient and adaptable:** 

 You’re comfortable prioritizing tasks and making decisions independently.
* **Education:** 

 A bachelor’s degree in computer science (or related field) is preferred.
* **Communication:** 

 Strong communicator who can collaborate across teams and levels.



  





**Bonus Points For:** 




  






 • Experience in
 
**fintech** 

 ,
 
**AI** 

 , or
 
**high-growth startups** 





 • CI/CD pipelines (e.g.,
 
**GitHub Actions** 

 )
 





 • Familiarity with
 
**AWS services** 




  





**Why Developers Love Working Here** 




  




* **Full Ownership:** 

 Shape products, influence architecture, and optimize workflows.
* **Cutting-Edge Projects:** 

 Build AI-driven credit decision tools, automation systems, and scalable backends.
* **Lean & Agile:** 

 No endless meetings—just focus on meaningful work.
* **Experienced Leadership:** 

 Collaborate with founders who have scaled and exited successful companies.
* **Strong Culture:** 

 Be part of a fun, supportive, trust-driven environment where collaboration, ownership, and continuous learning empower developers to take risks, innovate, and make a lasting impact.



  





**How to Apply** 





 Ready to take the next step? Submit your application through the
 
**“Apply Now”** 

 button on LinkedIn. We’ll be in touch soon.
 




  





**About Banky** 





 Founded in 2021, Banky is revolutionizing consumer credit by offering fairer, more transparent loans to underserved borrowers. Our mission is to eliminate high-cost credit, providing up to 200,000 SEK in personal loans with straightforward terms. By leveraging advanced data analytics, we assess applicants individually, focusing on their current financial capabilities rather than outdated credit histories. This personalized approach ensures that more people have access to loans that suit their needs and repayment abilities. Through our partnership with Bankaktiebolaget Nordiska, we create new financial opportunities for our customers. With €3.5 million in funding from renowned entrepreneurs and investors, already having reached profitability, we are rapidly expanding our product offerings and geographic reach. Join us in shaping the future of fair finance and improving the financial well-being of our customers.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
Do you want to challenge the status quo and be a part of the disruptive innovation that’s changing the traditional banking services?
   

  

 Do you want to work in an entrepreneurial environment yet have all the perks from being a part of an international media company?
   

  

 If yes, then take the opportunity to join the FinTech superstar Lendo. Lendo has already established a strong position in the Nordics. The newly acquired PSD2 licence creates opportunities in open banking, enabling us to further develop our value proposition and drive scalability in more markets.
   

  

**What You Tell Your Friends You Do**
 I am a developer at Lendo, where I'm enhancing proven products and establishing new ones within the loan comparison, account services and payment areas.
   

  

**What You Will Really Be Doing**
* Use a modern technology stack such as React, Javascript, Kubernetes, Docker, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL...etc.
* Create exciting new products and features
* Build, lead, design and optimize components to make them reusable for Lendo in multiple countries
* Build software that is used daily by a great number of user
* Take ownership of our projects and products!
* Collaborate closely with colleagues and the business to increase value for our users
* Prioritize work with the team and its Product Owner.
* Write tests at different levels to ensure quality and that your code really does what you want
* Identify and keep track of metrics that tell you how your software is performing
* Be creative and brainstorm ideas for ways we can further streamline our development
* Bring your own unique skill set to the table
* You’ll become part of an international, agile, multidisciplinary team that loves to discuss and solve problems in the group.
* You’ll experiment, test, try, fail and learn all the time


**We offer**
* A place for everyone - You are welcome at Lendo for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our product is for everyone, and so is our workplace!
* Room for you to do things your way
* We like to inspire your passion by organizing hackathons and other knowledge-sharing event
* A wellness program, if you want to do yoga, meditation, running and other activities with colleagues and coaches
* 4 000 SEK health promotion allowance
* 30 days of paid leave
* Super central location in Stockholm with a awesome rooftop- Please note that this position is based in Stockholm and offers a hybrid workplace setup. The required office days are Tuesdays and Wednesdays.
* And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as ping pong tables, team activities, and fun parties!

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
**Position Summary**
 As a Senior Software Developer at Tacton, you’ll contribute to building innovative and robust software solutions that power our renowned Configure, Price, and Quote (CPQ) product. In this role, you’ll leverage your technical expertise to create solutions that meet the needs of global manufacturers. With many exciting changes underway, Tacton offers opportunities to take on new challenges and responsibilities.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and Deliver: Design and implement scalable, robust applications using primarily Java and JavaScript
* Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with Product Managers, Architects, and other stakeholders to ensure deliveries are aligned with both technical and business objectives
* Maintain and Enhance: Continuously improve existing systems, enhancing functionality and addressing technical debt
* Document and Communicate: Clearly describe and document software solutions for team members and stakeholders
* Encourage Collaboration and Positivity: Join an experienced and supportive team, whose environment fosters collaboration, creativity, and a forward-thinking mindset


**Requirements**
 We are looking for a skilled software developer with over 5 years of experience in building and maintaining high-quality software products. You should have a strong background in Java, with the ability to develop scalable backend solutions, and the flexibility to contribute across the stack, including frontend technologies.
   

  

* Expertise in Java development
* Proven ability to transform functional needs into successful solutions
* Independent and self-managed work style
* Experience with cloud technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker and AWS
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken


**Preffered**
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices
* Typescript
* Experience in SaaS product development
* Knowledge of SQL, .Net, and C# (beneficial for certain projects)
* Strong communication skills
* Experience with test automation


**The Recruitment Process Consists Of**
* Screening call with Talent Acquisition
* First interview with our hiring manager
* Technical interview
* Interview with our CPO
* Reference check


**What We Offer**
 At Tacton, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career in a global organization that values teamwork and individual development. Working with cutting-edge technology, we tackle complex challenges in the manufacturing industry. We offer flexible working conditions, knowledge-sharing, and a culture built on mutual respect and collaboration.
   

  

**Our Culture and Why You Belong**
 Collaborative, Engaged, Trustworthy, Customer-Oriented, Visionary—if these values resonate with you, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 At Tacton, we celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome. Our team consists of people from all over the world, and we believe this diversity makes us stronger.
   

  

 As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we’re committed to fostering an environment where everyone can thrive. With our comprehensive onboarding program, you’ll be set up for success from day one.
   

  

 We look forward to your application—apply soon as we review candidates on a rolling basis.
   

  

**About Tacton**
*Tacton is a leading Software as a Service company trusted by global manufacturers. We got started in the late 1990’s when six computer scientists figured out a revolutionary way to help Manufacturers overcome their most business-critical, product configuration challenges. Since those early days, we have grown to support global manufacturers seeking to thrive in a changing world.*
*We invite you to find out more about us @* 
*www.tacton.com/about*
 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Software Engineer MarTech
description:
**We're looking for a Software Engineer to our MarTech team!**
*This position can be based in Stockholm or Oslo.*
 As a Software Engineer within Martech at Lendo you will design, build, and maintain microservices that enable seamless integrations with key marketing technologies such as Braze, Google Ads and Google Analytics, Meta Ads, etc, as well as support and maintain the data layer implementation. You will ensure the reliability, performance, and scalability of MarTech systems while collaborating closely with specialists to deliver best-practice, efficient, and secure solutions that enhance the organization’s marketing operations.
   

  

 You will work closely with MarTech and analytics implementation specialists, as well as data engineers and data scientists in the Data and Machine Learning team, which is responsible for the entirety of data flows across all markets and brands within Lendo Group.
   

  

**Aspects Of Work Include, But Are Not Limited To**
* Microservices development: Design, develop, and maintain scalable microservices to support MarTech integrations (e.g. Google Ads Customer Match, Enhanced Conversions).
* Tool integration: Collaborate with colleagues in the Data and Machine Learning team and relevant stakeholders to implement and optimize integrations with Braze, Google Ads (Enhanced Conversions, Customer Match), Meta, Google Analytics, and other tools.
* Server-side containers: Maintain the infrastructure for the server-side tag containers and assist in building advanced server-side data collection solutions.
* System maintenance: Implement and maintain monitoring and observability solutions to ensure reliability, performance, and security of the MarTech stack.
* Code quality: Write clean, efficient, well-documented code following best practices.
* Problem-solving: Debug and resolve issues in MarTech systems, ensuring minimal downtime and impact.
* Innovation: Stay up-to-date on the latest MarTech trends and suggest improvements to existing systems and processes.

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 You will act as both Tech Lead and Manager, in a perfect mix of leading people (Team of Developers) and developing code. Our aim is to consolidate the team of developers that you will lead in Stockholm. You will collaborate with your Product Partner, regarding planning and building the right products at the right time. You will be responsible for defining clear goals for your team and lead them in delivering on those goals.
   

  

 Apart from this, you are also responsible for setting salaries, helping individuals on your team grow and developing, as well as contributing technically to the team.
   

  

 As Tech Lead Manager you have a holistic perspective and the ability to inspire and lead others. You love working with tech and have experience working as a developer, working with code reviews, testing and quality assurance. You have at least one area where your team can rely on you making strong technical contributions.
   

  

* Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders
* Define quarterly goals and do weekly follow-ups
* Support and make sure the team members are the best they can be
* Develop and coach your team members individually
* Facilitate daily stand-ups and advise on agile WoW
* Contribute technically (wherever your strong area is) to the team


**Requirements**
* MSc/BS in computer science or similar degree
* Experience working as a Manager for a Tech Team
* Working in different contexts and organisations
* Interest in leadership and developing teams
* Proficient in English, both verbal and written
* Business minded and able to see the big picture
* A natural leader who is caring and inspiring
* Able to communicate clearly, both with your team and stakeholders
* Well organized and goal oriented


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Mobile SDK Developer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our mobile client SDKs are key to how our customers integrate their products with our platform. We have clients ranging from small businesses to large enterprises, and their mobile apps are used by millions of people worldwide. By developing our voice and video SDKs together with the team, you will play a pivotal role in powering all those real-time conversations.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Mobile SDK Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing mobile SDKs while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop SDKs using WebRTC technology to optimize real-time communication features.
* Work with the team to align SDK APIs and features across multiple platforms, including iOS, Android, and Web/JavaScript.
* Develop cross-platform solutions using a C++ codebase shared between iOS and Android.
* Design APIs with simplicity in mind while maintaining modularity, extensibility, and API stability over time.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Professional expertise in modern C++, especially in mobile applications development.
* Professional experience developing for the iOS and/or Android platform.
* Experience with at least one of Kotlin or Objective-C/Swift.
* Experience working in Linux/macOS development environments and CI pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Experience with WebRTC protocols and NAT traversal, including ICE, STUN, and TURN, is a significant advantage.
* Experience developing software libraries and/or SDKs consumed by other developers.
* In-depth knowledge of network protocols such as IP, TCP, UDP, and DNS.
* Great debugging and troubleshooting skills.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with remote work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Java Software Engineer
description:
Är du en passionerad Java-utvecklare? Vill du jobba med en global databasprodukt utvecklad av ett enastående lokalt team? Oavsett om du är en erfaren ingenjör eller precis har börjat din resa, välkomnar vi drivna och nyfikna personer som trivs med tekniska utmaningar.
 




  






 Vi söker nu att utöka vårt utvecklingsteam med en skicklig Java-utvecklare. Du kanske är en senior ingenjör som har jobbat med databaser, desktop- och webbapplikationer och har byggt både ramverk och verksamhetskod, designat API:er och användargränssnitt, satt upp infrastruktur, lett andra ingenjörer och drivit produktutveckling. Eller så är du bara i början av din utvecklarkarriär. I vilket fall som helst kan du vara rätt person så länge du är driven, nyfiken och inte rädd för tekniska utmaningar.
 




  






 Du tycker att det låter kul att jobba med databaser, prestanda, parsning och syntaxanalys, UX, UI, REST API:er, webbapplikationer, molnmiljöer och AI. Du föredrar en bred och omväxlande roll där du kan lära dig mycket framför att jobba smalt. Du är målmedveten, tar ansvar och älskar att lösa problem.
 




  






 Produkten du kommer att arbeta med är DbVisualizer, en universell databasklient som används av tiotusentals utvecklare och analytiker världen över. Du kommer främst jobba med Java men du behöver ha ett öppet sinne och vara intresserad av andra teknologier för att passa i rollen.
 




  






 Vi är ett litet, högkvalificerat team där initiativtagande och förmågan att förvandla idéer till verklighet är avgörande. Våra utvecklare äger hela produktlivscykeln, vilket innebär att vi analyserar, designar, kodar, testar och supportar produkten själva. Vårt mål är att erbjuda en produkt med den bästa kvalitén på marknaden - inte bara vad gäller fel men också prestanda, smarta funktioner och användbarhet. Och det är så vi skiljer oss från konkurrenterna.
 




  






 Vi sitter i Stockholm och flyttar snart till ett nytt kontor på Söder Mälarstrand 21 med en enastående utsikt över vattnet, Gamla stan och Stadshuset.
 




  






 Vår vision är att bygga de bästa databasverktygen i världen med ett tight lokalt team här i Stockholm. Låter detta som rätt utmaning för dig? Ansök nu eller kontakta oss för mer information.
 




  






 Mer info och ansökan:
 





 ﻿
 
 https://www.dbvis.com/company/job/java-software-engineer/
 



  





**Huvudansvar** 



* Utveckla DbVisualizer, en uppskattad databasklient som används av utvecklare och analytiker i hela världen



  





**Du har** 



* Starka kunskaper inom systemarkitektur och är expert på Java
* Bra koll på databaser och SQL
* Flytande svenska och engelska



  





**Relevanta kvalifikationer** 



* Java, Swing, FlatLaf
* Desktop- och webbapplikationer
* Design av användargränssnitt
* Molntjänster och arkitektur
* Relations- och NoSQL-databaser
* Erfarenhet av JavaScript, Python, React, Node.js och open source-projekt är meriterande



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* En stimulerande miljö med fantastiska kollegor och spännande tekniska utmaningar
* En uppskattad produkt som används över hela världen
* Ett litet företag där ditt bidrag verkligen spelar roll

title: Online Portfolio Developer
description:

title: Software Engineer - Roku (Brightscript)
description:
**Description**
**About the Team**
 We are passionate about technology and building fantastic software products. We are experts and leaders in the realm of video streaming. It’s no coincidence that some of our customers are giants like Netflix, Spotify, BBC, HBO and Deutsche Telekom, just to name a few. Our mission is to innovate continuously and to disrupt the industry by creating a scalable platform for building impactful video applications. Accedo One , our award-winning produc t is a testament to Accedo’s expertise and leadership worldwide.
   

  

 To continue to excel, we are growing our team with multiple openings! We’re looking for a Roku Engineer to join our team in Stockholm. (Did we say we have offices all over the world, including Stockholm, Budapest, London, New York, Toronto, Sydney, and Hong Kong, amongst others?). At Accedo you will be part of a diverse and multi-disciplined development team, gaining exposure to cutting edge technologies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Competitive salary and benefits
* Premium pension plan
* Company life, health and injury insurance
* Yearly health allowance
* Yearly training budget - which can be spent on IT conferences or online trainings
* Nice, spacious downtown office in the hip neighborhood of Södermalm
* Flexible home office options.
* Opportunity to participate in Hackathons and a range of company events


**What You Will Do**
 Primarily software development of Roku/Brightscript applications. You will work on delivering the Roku application of our state-of-the art products.
   

  

* You will play a key role in designing, building and maintaining large-scale, high availability front-end applications and owning the related platform infrastructure (e.g AWS services, build pipelines, automated testing, etc).

* This is the team you want to join! We care about software craftsmanship, constantly improving our work and ourselves while having fun doing it!


**Requirements**
