title: Customer Success Manager, Sweden
description:
Location: Stockholm, Sweden Department: Customer Success Posted Date: 2/4/2025
   

  

**Customer Success Manager (m/f/x) - Sweden**
**About AvePoint**
 Securing the Future. AvePoint is a global leader in data management and data governance, and over 21,000 customers worldwide rely on our solutions to modernize the digital workplace across Microsoft, Google, Salesforce and other collaboration environments. AvePoint’s global channel partner program includes over 3,500 managed service providers, value added resellers and systems integrators, with our solutions available in more than 100 cloud marketplaces. To learn more, visit
 **www.avepoint.com** 
 .
   

  

 At AvePoint, we are committed to investing in our people. Agility, passion and teamwork set us up to do our best work and foster a culture where you are empowered to craft your career, make an impact, and own (y)our future. Unleash the power of you!
   

  

**What will you be doing?**
 The Customer Success Manager (CSM) will be responsible for generating repeatable strategy of technology adoption for AvePoint customers. You must be able to understand the full sales cycle from both a sales and technical strategy perspective to liaise between internal and external stakeholders, such as customers, account managers and technical support engineers.
   

  

**About The Position**
 The Customer Success Manager (CSM) will be responsible for generating repeatable strategy of technology adoption for AvePoint customers. You must be able to understand the full sales cycle from both a sales and technical strategy perspective to liaise between internal and external stakeholders, such as customers, account managers and technical support engineers.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Developing business value assessment program by creating customer success metrics to support product on-boarding, product adoption as well as customer retention and satisfaction goals
* Developing and maintaining long-term relationships with key accounts; coordinating support efforts and organizing solution delivery whilst establishing and owning a trusted advisor relationship with your customers
* Maintaining customer technical account portfolio to provide technical guidance and recommendation
* Aligning AvePoint’s product line to provide a comprehensive solution that satisfies the customer’s business needs
* Determining individualized customer success plans for your customers, utilizing net promoter score (NPS) metrics and other customer data
* Working closely with account managers to understand the short-term and long-term sales strategies to identify keys areas to drive customer success through product adoption and satisfaction
* Shepherding existing customers through contract renewal cycles and working with sales teams to execute renewals
* Identifying and understanding a customer’s adoption status and support history throughout the post-sales cycle; determining how to incorporate these elements into the overall customer success strategy
* Pursuing strategy of goal attainment to rectify any hurdles and steer client towards success
* Becoming an expert in the features and benefits of our applications
* Delivering web-based and/or onsite product overviews and training sessions for clients
* Conduct basic technical consultancy with clients regarding AvePoint Products


**OK, I'm interested... is this the job for me?**
 We look for people who value agility, passion and teamwork; those who can bring fresh ideas to the table and want the opportunity to learn, grow, and expand their careers. Bring your aptitude and build upon what you do best for our customers, partners, team, and you.
   

  

**What You Will Bring To Our Team**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education
* Several years of experience in a technical consulting role such as technical account management or technical business analysis
* Strong customer satisfaction, customer service, adoption, and retention experience
* Excellent written/verbal communication in Swedish and English - any additional Scandinavian language is a plus
* Strong organization, presentation, and project management skills
* Ability to work individually and within a highly collaborative global team setting
* Willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment
* Strong experience in communicating with different stakeholders and decision makers, both internally and externally
* Expert at customer relationship management
* Advanced ability to understand business objectives through requirements gathering and analysis


**Knowledge In The Following Technical Areas Are a Plus**
* Understanding of Microsoft SharePoint architecture, components, and configuration. Understand the differences between the SharePoint versions and Office 365 collaboration technologies
* Working knowledge of TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, Active Directory, SMTP, and DHCP technologies
* Other cloud knowledge like Google workspace, Amazon Web Services


**Benefits We Offer**
* Competitive market-based compensation
* Work-life balance through a hybrid working model
* Career progression and internal mobility opportunities
* EUR1.000,00/Year towards our Tuition Reimbursement Program
* Employee Referral Program
* Corporate Donation Matching Program
* Company sponsored events / regular team building events
* 30 PTO/Year, plus all public holidays and access to AvePoint holidays!
* ... and much more!


 AvePoint is proud to employ talent from many different backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that diversity and inclusion drives our success and is at the core of how we hire, communicate, and collaborate to deliver value and excellence. We are committed to fostering an environment where people can bring their whole selves to work and feel a sense of belonging, and we continue to work toward creating a workforce that represents the diversity of our customers and communities.
   

  

 Any personal data you share with us during the application process will be processed strictly in compliance with applicable data protection laws and our Privacy Notice.

title: RAN Solution Engineer
description:
We are now looking for a RAN Solution Engineer to join our growing team in Stockholm! In this role you will mostly be working with customers in Stockholm, but some traveling to customers in other Nordic countries will be expected. Are you our next RAN solution expert?
 *Get the future you want and apply today!*
**Responsibilities**
* Lead the design and implementation of RAN networks, including LTE, and 5G NR (New Radio) technologies.
* Oversee the deployment and integration of RAN nodes (e.g., eNBs, gNBs, RRU, BBU, Small Cells) into existing networks. Ensure proper network functionality and performance or worked in past for these kinds of roles.
* Design, validate, and implement 5G architecture and next-gen technologies (e.g., Carrier Aggregation (CA), MIMO, Massive MIMO, beamforming, Network Slicing).
* Provide input into the strategic planning of future RAN technologies. Lead initiatives in network automation, cloud-native RAN, and virtualized RAN (vRAN),
* Support pre-sales team and Articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users
* Ability to deliver presentations and demonstrations confidently to technical and non-technical audiences
* Work closely with core network engineers, backhaul engineers, and service providers to ensure seamless integration of RAN with the broader network.
* Ensure compliance with local and international regulatory requirements and standards for network deployment and operations.
* Undertake technical ownership and responsibility for small to medium sized opportunities and accounts
* Drive the pre-sales discussions, presentations and customer meetings


**Required Skills & Qualifications**
* Min 10 years in RAN design, optimization, and troubleshooting, with at least 5 years of experience in 5G/LTE technologies.
* Strong understanding of 4G LTE, 5G NR, including radio interface protocols, PHY/MAC layers, and eNB/gNB configurations.
* Expertise in 5G NR technology, 5G core network integration, network slicing, and related 5G innovations (e.g., massive MIMO, beamforming, Carrier Aggregation).

title: Partner Development Manager
description:
Location: Stockholm, Sweden Department: Sales Posted Date: 2/4/2025
   

  

**Partner Development Manager - Sweden
   

  

**About AvePoint:****
 Securing the Future. AvePoint is a global leader in data management and data governance, and over 21,000 customers worldwide rely on our solutions to modernize the digital workplace across Microsoft, Google, Salesforce and other collaboration environments. AvePoint’s global channel partner program includes over 3,500 managed service providers, value added resellers and systems integrators, with our solutions available in more than 100 cloud marketplaces. To learn more, visit www.avepoint.com.
   

  

 At AvePoint, we are committed to investing in our people. Agility, passion and teamwork set us up to do our best work and foster a culture where you are empowered to craft your career, make an impact, and own (y)our future. Unleash the power of you!
   

  

****Overview****
 AvePoint is seeking a Partner Development Manager to recruit, convert, and enable prospective MSP’s and VAR partners. In this role, you will be responsible for prospecting, qualifying, building partner relationships, and other elements of the presales cycle leading to transaction and sell through to the partners customer base.
   

  

 We are looking for creative thinkers who are confident and self-motivated with an entrepreneurial mindset. You take pride in seeing your hard work pay off when you see the final results and are determined to help others succeed.
   

  

****Your Responsibilities Will Include:****
* Proactively source new prospects
* Nurture, cross-sell and upsell existing MSP Partners
* Collaborate with cross-functional team members in different territories to execute sales plays and build local relationships to drive results
* Partner Sourced Revenue Target Achievement


**OK, I'm interested… is this job for me?**
 We look for people who value agility, passion and teamwork; those who can bring fresh ideas to the table and want the opportunity to learn, grow, and expand their careers. Bring your aptitude and build upon what you do best for our customers, partners, team, and you.
   

  

**Other qualities you'll need to be a fit for this role include:**
* 2-3 years previous partner management experience in the SaaS hemisphere
* BA/BS in Business, Marketing, Communications, or similar relevant field
* Strong communication skills to articulate company vision, product changes, and adapting to new strategies - must be business fluent in Swedish & English
* Ability to execute in an environment where priorities change quickly, demonstrating agility, adaptability, and problem solving skills
* Entrepreneurial mindset and detail oriented


****About AvePoint****
 AvePoint is proud to employ talent from many different backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that diversity and inclusion drives our success and is at the core of how we hire, communicate, and collaborate to deliver value and excellence. We are committed to fostering an environment where people can bring their whole selves to work and feel a sense of belonging, and we continue to work toward creating a workforce that represents the diversity of our customers and communities.
   

  

 Any personal data you share with us during the application process will be processed strictly in compliance with applicable data protection laws and our Privacy Notice.

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: IT Business Analyst within Credit Risk
description:
**YOUR ROLE**
 We are looking for an
 **IT Business Analyst** 
 to join our
 **Financial Services team** 
 . In the role you will be a trusted advisor working with some of Sweden’s most well-known banks and insurance companies in projects. You will guide our customers with everything from strategy and planning to implementation and management.
   

  

 A crucial part of the role is to identify and analyze functional and technical requirements connected to Credit Risk. You are the link between the customer and the development team and will ensure that the applications meet the requirements of future users. The role has an established career path within Capgemini, where you will have the opportunity to grow into other roles in the long run.
   

  

**Tasks Include**
* Initiating business and process improvements.
* Capturing requirements through workshops with customers.
* Communicating with stakeholders about priorities, changing requirements and test results.
* An interest in new technologies.


**YOUR PROFILE**
* 8-10 years prior IT experience within Financial Services.
* 3-4 years of functional background around Credit Risk and understanding of Credit Risk modelling, PD, LGD and EAD modelling.
* Experience in handling huge datasets.
* Knowledge of specifying and analyzing functional and technical requirements.
* Understanding of UT, ST and end-to-end UAT testing. Added advantage in creating functional test cases and validating the results.
* Experience in doing data analysis using SQL. Knowing SAS/Python is an added advantage.
* Experience from working with regulatory requirements, digitalization as well as agile methodology is meritorious.
* Fluency in Swedish is beneficial.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
 At Capgemini, you get to work with the biggest customers within banking and insurance, in exciting and varied roles, giving you the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally. We keep everyone connected, with learning activities and social events. With the freedom to grow, you get access to a wide range of our global comprehensive training programs. In the team we like to learn from each other and have fun in the process. We focus on inclusion and embrace and empower talent in all its diverse forms and origins. We are valuing work-life balance with flexible working arrangements in order for you to balance your work life with your personal life.
   

  

**APPLICATION**
 Don’t hesitate to send in your application. We will be interviewing continuously and look forward to finding our next colleague. Warm welcome with your application!

title: Enterprise (Senior) Account Executive SaaS - Sweden
description:
Join our team in Stockholm and be part of our International market expansion in Sweden and the Nordics, with a specific focus on
 **enterprise clients** 
 (with fair sales targets and an uncapped bonus). As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will have end-to-end responsibility for the sales process, from
 **lead generation to contract signing** 
 , while actively acquiring
 **new customers** 
 .
   

  

**Your Tasks Scope**
* Engage proactively with C-level, demonstrating a strong approach to drive sales
* Navigate from lead generation to contract signing, emphasizing the acquisition of new clients - sales cycle between 1-1,5 years.
* Build a robust pipeline, guide clients through analysis, and present the return on investment of the business case to consistently deliver added value.
* Our intensive onboarding and continuous training programs will enhance your skills and knowledge
* Consultative selling: Act as a Consultant to the client by being an expert in workforce management - we don´t exepect you to already be an expert, learn with/from us


**Your Skills**
* 5-10 years of sales experience in B2B, preferably in software sales, and at least 2 years of experience in dealing with large businesses
* Fluent in Swedish and proficient in English - Norwegian, Danish and Finnish can be beneficial
* Ability to understand complex technical concepts and develop them into a consultative sale
* Enthusiasm for digitalization and a willingness to travel as a sales manager, staying up to date with market trends and opportunities

**We Offer**

* Company culture: Flexibility with Hybrid Work (Work from Home/Work from EU), 30 days of vacation, Diversity & Inclusion Team, (virtual) events for employees (e.g., Summer camps), Barista at the Headquarter, Volunteer Day
* Career and Development: Career model with Expert- & Leadership Track, ATOSS Academy, LinkedIn Learning
* Health: Check-ups, health initiatives, Wellhub
* Security & Stability: Listed on the stock market: SDax & TecDax, over 30% EBIT margin, Scale-up, 18 years of record revenue and results, visibility, future-oriented product

title: Senior Consultants to the Telecom, Media & Technology team (Stockholm)
description:
Join Capgemini Invent's dynamic team in the Nordics and unleash your passion for the Telecom, Media & Technology (TMT) industry!
   

  

 As a key player in our digital innovation powerhouse, you will drive end-to-end digital transformations and enhance customer experiences for leading companies. With a rich 55-year heritage and a diverse global team of over 360,000, Capgemini combines strategy, technology, data science, and creative design to tackle complex challenges and unlock new value. We empower CxOs to envision the future across nearly 40 studios worldwide while staying ahead of industry trends—such as 5G, Edge Cloud, AI-driven automation, and sustainability initiatives —to deliver actionable insights and transformative projects for our clients. We are actively seeking Senior Consultants to join our expanding TMT Consulting Unit. This is your opportunity to make a significant impact in the telecom sector and be part of a trusted advisory team that shapes the future of TMT!
   

  

 Who are we looking for?
   

  

* Passion for Telecom: Strong interest in how technology impacts business within the Telecom, Media, and Tech sectors
* Experience: 2+ years in management consultancy, telecom operators, media, or hi-tech companies in roles such as product management, marketing, or business development
* Digital Transformation: Familiarity with digital operators and large transformation programs is preferred
* Team Player: Excellent communication skills and a commitment to delivering high-quality results
* Proactive Mindset: Entrepreneurial spirit with a strong drive for continuous learning and personal development
* Education: Master’s degree in Business Administration or Engineering from a reputable university
* Language Skills: Fluency in English; proficiency in Nordic languages is a plus


 You will join our TMT team at our modern office in Stockholm, Kungsholmen, just a short walk from T-Centralen, featuring panoramic views of the city. Please note that travel and client site work will be required.
   

  

 Does this sound like your next opportunity? Are you ready to create the future you desire? Apply now by submitting your CV in English. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

title: Design Engineer - Trucks
description:
**We are looking for Design Engineers to join our Mechanical & Physical team in Stockholm. Apply today and become a part of Capgemini Engineering and get the future you want!
   

  

 The role**
 As a Design Engineer, you will work with product development services towards our clients. As a consultant at Capgemini Engineering, you will get the opportunity to work in different projects matching your experience, background, and interests.
   

  

 You will be an important and central part of our cross-functional team and responsible for implementations and goals in our projects. You may have frequent contact with our clients' organizations. You are responsible for the execution of your assignment from concept to finished product. We want everyone who works at Capgemini Engineering to feel that there are clear career paths and opportunities to broaden their skills. There are also possibilities to take on internal roles such as mentoring or team lead, and your career will be built close together with your team lead.

**Engineering Tomorrow, Today**

title: Digital Sales & Growth Specialist
description:
**Digital Sales & Growth Specialist** 




 Location: Hybrid
 



 Start Date: ASAP
 



 Employment Type: Full-time
 



  





**Join Hale – Leading the Future of Breathwork** 




 Hale is a fast-growing startup transforming the way people breathe through high-quality, scientifically-backed breathwork solutions. Our subscription-based app, digital courses, and wellness studio licensing provide multiple ways for customers to engage with us, making breathwork accessible and impactful. As we scale, we are looking for a
 **Digital Sales & Growth Specialist** 
 to drive revenue growth, optimize digital sales processes, and integrate systems for maximum efficiency. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment, is data-driven, and understands how to build and optimize digital sales funnels while also managing essential social media functions in a strategic, sales-focused way
 **.** 




  





**Your Mission** 




 As
 **Digital Sales & Growth Specialist** 
 , your role is to increase Hale’s revenue by optimizing digital sales channels, ensuring smooth system integrations, and implementing strategies that maximize customer conversions. You will own the digital sales journey, from strategy to execution, working across platforms to enhance performance.
 



 This role will drive sales for:
 



 ✅ App subscriptions (B2C)
 



 ✅ Studio licensing and partnerships (B2B)
 



 ✅ Breath Guide Training sales (B2B2C)
 



 ✅ Corporate wellness and new business opportunities
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




 1. Digital Sales & Conversion Optimization
 


* Develop and execute digital sales strategies to drive revenue growth.
* Optimize digital funnels for higher conversion rates, ensuring that customers move seamlessly from awareness to purchase.
* Manage and improve email marketing, SEO, and paid advertising strategies to drive online sales.



 2. System Integration & Automation
 


* Ensure CRM, email marketing, and e-commerce tools work together smoothly to enhance the customer journey.
* Identify and implement automation solutions to streamline the sales process.
* Manage and optimize integrations between platforms



 3. Performance Analytics & Reporting
 


* Track and analyze digital sales performance and KPIs to optimize strategies.
* Use data-driven insights to refine conversion strategies and customer acquisition tactics.
* Provide reports and strategic recommendations to the Head of Marketing.



 4. Social Media Management (Sales-Focused)
 


* Use social media as a lead generation tool, leveraging organic and paid strategies.
* Respond to audience interactions in a way that supports the sales process.
* Stay updated on digital sales trends, customer behavior, and competitors' strategies.



  





**What We Are Looking For** 




**You should have:** 




 ✅ At least 2 years of experience in digital sales, e-commerce, SaaS, or a related field, with a strong track record of driving revenue.
 



 ✅ Expertise in sales funnels, customer journey optimization, and conversion rate improvements.
 



 ✅ Experience with CRM, email marketing, paid ads, and analytics tools
 



 ✅ Strong analytical skills and a data-driven approach to sales.
 



 ✅ The ability to manage social media strategically—not as a content creator, but as a sales-driven tool.
 



 ✅ The ability to thrive in a fast-moving startup environment and take ownership of key growth initiatives.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




 🚀 Impactful Role – A key position in a fast-scaling, app-first wellness startup.
 



 🌍 Growth Opportunities – Opportunity to shape and lead international expansion in the EU, Norway, and the UK.
 



 💡 Autonomy – Freedom to build and execute a high-impact sales strategy.
 



 🌱 Mission-Driven Work – Work on a product that is improving people’s well-being internationally.
 



 👥 Supportive & Collaborative Team – Join a passionate, ambitious, and close-knit team that values innovation, collaboration, and personal growth. We foster an environment where your ideas matter, and you’ll work alongside inspiring individuals who are redefining the breathwork industry.
 



  





**How to Apply** 




 Send your CV and a short motivation letter to hj@hale.center

title: Management Consulting Director CVX Ventures Sweden
description:
**Jobbeskrivning - Management Consulting Director** 
**CVX Ventures Sweden**
 Trivs du i en snabb och dynamisk miljö där du får stort strategiskt och operativt ansvar? Vill du vara en del av ett exceptionellt entreprenörsteam med unga, motiverade och extremt drivna individer? Är du nyfiken på eller passionerad för riskkapital? Då kan du vara vår nya Management Consulting Director i Sverige.
   

  

**Ditt Mission**
 Vi söker en exceptionell Management Consulting Director för att bygga upp och leda vår svenska verksamhet i Stockholm. Som den första personen på plats är detta en hands-on roll där ditt initiala fokus kommer att ligga på att etablera och underhålla en stark försäljningspipeline, säkerställa korrekt prognostisering och slutföra deals. Du är mycket driven, proaktiv och med en naturlig förmåga att skapa förtroende och bygga relationer med människor.
   

  

**Vårt Mission**
 CVX är en av Europas snabbast växande riskkapitalaktörer, på väg att bli Europas största riskinvesterare genom att erbjuda snabbväxande bolag kapital, kunskap och nätverk.
   

  

 Vi drivs av tron att de bästa investerarna är de som kan ge grundare rätt kunskap, erfarenhet och nätverk för specifika skeden och branscher. CVX investerar alltid tillsammans med de bästa affärsänglarna för varje enskild grundare.
   

  

 Idag har CVX över 600 partners som investerar och bidrar till bolag där de kan göra verklig skillnad. CVX består nu av 20 ambitiösa individer i Köpenhamn, London, Oslo – och snart även i Stockholm.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Utveckla och implementera din strategi för svenska marknaden
* Leda expansionen i Sverige, inklusive potentiella förvärv
* Ansvara för den svenska resultat- och balansräkningen samt den operativa verksamheten
* Bygga upp en stor och kvalitativ grupp av partners
* Rekrytera, utveckla och leda ett högpresterande team om 10–15 personer inom försäljning, styrelsearbete, evenemang samt investeringar
* Identifiera och attrahera de bästa investeringsmöjligheterna
* Driva hela investeringsprocessen från prospektering till investering
* Representera CVX vid evenemang, sammankomster och konferenser.
* Rapportera direkt till CEO.


**Vad vi förväntar oss av dig**
* Hög arbetsmoral och "sense of urgency"
* Exceptionell drivkraft och vilja vara bäst på det du gör
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet, gärna inom riskkapital, snabbväxande startups eller dynamiska miljöer
* Proaktivitet och förmåga att ta ägandeskap för allt du gör
* Starkt intresse för riskkapital och startups med passion för att analysera och investera i företag
* Stark förmåga att skapa samarbete och tillit mellan människor, samt vinna förtroende hos affärsledare
* Förmåga att kommunicera effektivt på lednings- och styrelsenivå
* Utmärkta analytiska och problemlösande färdigheter
* Naturlig förmåga att sälja och framgångar med att nå och överträffa intäktsmål
* En naturlig ledare, helst med erfarenhet av att leda team
* Flytande svenska och engelska
* Stort plus om du har ett nätverk inom det svenska startup-ekosystemet.


**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 Som Management Consulting Director hos oss får du en resa fylld med personlig utveckling, karriärmöjligheter och tillväxt. I denna roll kommer du att utveckla dina ledarskapsförmågor genom projekt och coachning inom den svenska och danska venture-miljön.
   

  

* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö med ambitiösa och talangfulla kollegor
* En kultur präglad av kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling
* Möjlighet att ha direkt inverkan på CVX och portföljbolagens framgång
* Coaching och utvecklingsmöjligheter
* Kombination av fast lön och resultatbaserade incitament.


**Startdatum:** 
 Så snart som möjligt.

title: Junior Process Engineer
description:
Introduction
  
Do you want to work for a company which makes the coolest high-tech components in the world? A company that invests heavily to create a unique work environment for its employees? A company with diversity and competence you will have a hard time finding anywhere else? Do you want to be a part of our team? Then you should keep reading.
  
About Low Noise Factory
  
Low Noise Factory (LNF) designs and produces the world’s best low noise microwave amplifiers. These amplifiers are used near absolute zero –cryogenic– temperatures for space exploration, quantum computing, radio astronomy, and for various ground-breaking scientific endeavors where extreme sensitivity is paramount. Our amplifiers help receive signals from the most distant man-made object from Earth, the Voyager 1 space probe, help read quantum states in the fastest quantum computers, and help make MRI scanners work in medical institutions. Low Noise Factory’s state-of-the-art amplifiers are far ahead of the competition. We invest heavily in research and collaborate closely with academic and scientific communities to keep advancing our technology further and further. Our success is the result of passion for science and precision, advanced by devotion and curiosity. As explorers on the technological frontier, our aim is to keep making the impossible possible. We do everything from basic research to product development, production and testing. In our 1500 sqm facility in Gothenburg, we work in state-of-the-art laboratories; from electronics assembly labs to high frequency cryogenic testing. In addition, we have access to advanced cleanrooms where we develop and produce our semiconductor circuits. LNF is today 22 employees with a background from 14 different countries.
  
Job description
  
We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly motivated Semiconductor Cleanroom Process Technician/Engineer to support the day-to-day processing of Monolithic Microwave Integrated Circuits (MMICs) in a cleanroom environment. You will be responsible for operating and maintaining semiconductor fabrication equipment, ensuring adherence to process specifications, and troubleshooting issues to optimize yield and throughput.
  
Responsibilities
  
* Be an active part of our cleanroom processing team
* Participate in our daily MMIC production tasks in the cleanroom including process planning and documentation.


Requirements and qualifications
  
* M.Sc. or B.Sc. degree in engineering, physics or similar degrees.
* Prior hands-on experience in cleanroom fabrication
* Familiarity with semiconductor processing techniques such as photolithography, dry/wet etching, thin-film deposition
* Proficient in written and spoken English
* Attentive to details and team player


Valuable additional skills
  
* Knowledge of III-V semiconductor device physics
* Experience with different metrology and surface profiling tools (optical microscope, SEM, TEM, AFM, ellipsometer)
* Experience with electron-beam lithography
* Experience with electrical measurements of semiconductor devices.
* Experience with CAD software (AutoCAD or others)


Benefits and terms
  
* Fulltime 40h/week • Flexible workhours • 30 days’ vacation per year • Occupational pension • Health maintenance benefit (Friskvårdsbidrag) • Occupational health services (Företagshälsovård) • Private medical treatment insurance • Food benefit


How to apply send your application to career@lownoisefactory.com last day of application: March 31st 2025

title: QA Automation Engineer IRC250572
description:
**Description:**
 We are looking for a QA Automation Engineer for an onsite position in Stockholm, Sweden. This role offers the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment, combining automation expertise with hands-on hardware testing, while collaborating closely with engineering teams to enhance product quality and performance.
   

  

**Requirements:**
**Main Requirements:**
* Experience with Automation: Proficiency in automation frameworks (Java, Python).
* Hands-on Hardware Experience: Practical experience with hardware testing, particularly related to navigation systems in vehicles.
* Communication Skills: Strong ability to liaise between teams and gather feedback from engineers.
* Driving Requirements: Should be able to drive a truck as a passenger and collect navigation data on the road. A truck driver’s license is a plus.
* Senior-Level Expertise: Proven experience in setting up QA frameworks, particularly in automation, and working in a cross-functional engineering environment.


**Preferences:**
**Job Responsibilities:**
* Setting Up Processes & Frameworks: Design, implement, and optimize QA processes and automation frameworks, focusing on Java and Python.
* Hardware Testing: Conduct hands-on testing of navigation systems in real-world driving scenarios (on-site in Stockholm or near Södertälje).
* Navigation Data Collection: Test a truck during driving to collect navigation data, ensuring accurate logs and feedback from on-road tests.
* Collaboration with Engineering Teams: Communicate effectively with engineers to gather and analyze feedback, ensuring continuous improvement of products.
* Automation Development: Contribute to the transition from manual to automated testing by developing, maintaining, and improving automated test scripts and frameworks.


**What We Offer**
**Empowering Projects:** 
 With 500+ clients spanning diverse industries and domains, we provide an exciting opportunity to contribute to groundbreaking projects that leverage cutting-edge technologies. As a team, we engineer digital products that positively impact people’s lives.
   

  

**Empowering Growth:** 
 We foster a culture of continuous learning and professional development. Our dedication is to provide timely and comprehensive assistance for every consultant through our dedicated Learning & Development team, ensuring their continuous growth and success.
   

  

**DE&I Matters:** 
 At GlobalLogic, we deeply value and embrace
 **diversity** 
 . We are dedicated to providing
 **equal** 
 opportunities for all individuals, fostering an
 **inclusive** 
 and empowering work environment.
   

  

**Career Development:** 
 Our corporate culture places a strong emphasis on career development, offering abundant opportunities for growth. Regular interactions with our teams ensure their engagement, motivation, and recognition. We empower our team members to pursue their career goals with confidence and enthusiasm.
   

  

**Comprehensive Benefits:** 
 In addition to equitable compensation, we provide a comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes the overall well-being of our consultants. We genuinely care about their health and strive to create a positive work environment.
   

  

**Flexible Opportunities:** 
 At GlobalLogic, we prioritize work-life balance by offering flexible opportunities tailored to your lifestyle. Explore relocation and rotation options for diverse cultural and professional experiences in different countries with our company.
   

  

**About GlobalLogic** 
 GlobalLogic is a leader in digital engineering. We help brands across the globe design and build innovative products, platforms, and digital experiences for the modern world. By integrating experience design, complex engineering, and data expertise—we help our clients imagine what’s possible, and accelerate their transition into tomorrow’s digital businesses. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, GlobalLogic operates design studios and engineering centers around the world, extending our deep expertise to customers in the automotive, communications, financial services, healthcare and life sciences, manufacturing, media and entertainment, semiconductor, and technology industries. GlobalLogic is a Hitachi Group Company operating under Hitachi, Ltd. (TSE: 6501) which contributes to a sustainable society with a higher quality of life by driving innovation through data and technology as the Social Innovation Business.
